import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np



[docs]class function1d:
	'''
	This is a benchmark of unidimensional functions interesting to optimize. 
	:param bounds: the box constraints to define the domain in which the function is optimized.
	'''

[docs]	def plot(self,bounds=None):
		if bounds == None: bounds = self.bounds
		X = np.arange(bounds[0][0], bounds[0][1], 0.01)
		Y = self.f(X)
		plt.plot(X, Y, lw=2)
		plt.xlabel('x')
		plt.ylabel('f(x)')
		plt.show()



[docs]class forrester(function1d):
	'''
	Forrester function. 
	
	:param sd: standard deviation, to generate noisy evaluations of the function.
	'''
	def __init__(self,sd=None):
		self.input_dim = 1		
		if sd==None: self.sd = 0
		else: self.sd=sd
		self.min = 0.78 		## approx
		self.fmin = -6 			## approx
		self.bounds = [(0,1)]


[docs]	def f(self,X):
		X = X.reshape((len(X),1))
		n = X.shape[0]
		fval = ((6*X -2)**2)*np.sin(12*X-4)
		if self.sd ==0:
			noise = np.zeros(n).reshape(n,1)
		else:
			noise = np.random.normal(0,self.sd,n).reshape(n,1)
		return fval.reshape(n,1) + noise
